posts.post_content:
Posted By: Brian
i have a sharp looking N28 Mike Kelly ending on ebay tomorrow morning. It looks like a 5, but got agrade of 2 because of erased pencil marks on teh back. 

[url]http://cgi.ebay.com/ws/eBayISAPI.dll?ViewItem&item=330278858002&_trksid=p3907.m32&_trkparms=tab%3DSelling[/url]

Posted By: GoSoxBoSox
I have to be honest.  I was seriously considering going after this when I saw it earlier this week but your feedback scared the hell out of me.

Do you care to comment why you have 7 negs and 2 neutrals on just 84 transactions?  Many of us here have zero to a handful of negs on many thousands of transactions.  So that kind of service doesn't make us feel confortable.

What's the deal?

Posted By: Brian Koyama
I'm not the seller, but I was checking out the card as well.  Here's what the seller posted on the auction:

On Oct-16-08 at 06:52:28 PDT, seller added the following information:


hello, I have gotten a few question concerning my feedback issues. I want to ease everyone's mind.. The past negative feedback came in a time when I was newly diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis. it was a hard time for me. I took time off from selling on eBay to get health in order.
 
since I do have the negative feedback, eBay an PayPal have made it so I do not get paid on my auctions until YOU leave me positive feedback. So you really have nothing to worry about. I will not able to access your payment until YOU leave me positive feedback. 
 
So, please bid with confidence.

Posted By: Dan Bretta
I've not followed N28 prices, but that seems to me like it went very cheap.

Posted By: Brian
it did go cheap.. i lost about $150 on it.. but i needed to sell.. and es, iwas in the middle of a very hard time with newley diagnosed Ms when igot the negs.
